Key Match Events: The Brewers used the long ball with Rhys Hoskins hitting a grand slam on Friday.The Brewers got clutch hits in the fourth inning against Jose Quintana and piled on in the eighth against Reed Garrett and Danny Young.The Brewers have the second-best save percentage in the game, rarely blowing leads.The Brewers have the third-best bullpen ERA in the National League.The Brewers' position-player group is the third-youngest in baseball and performs with daily energy.
Pre-Game Insights: Brewers manager Pat Murphy compared the team to a football team, emphasizing their ability to win in multiple ways.The Brewers are locked in as the No. 3 seed in the National League, awaiting a matchup with potential wild card teams.The Brewers have proven to be a thorn in the Mets' side this year.
Post-Match Reflections: Brandon Nimmo praised the Brewers' bullpen, noting their elite stuff and effectiveness.Mets manager Carlos Mendoza highlighted the Brewers' execution and clutch hits as key factors.The Brewers' strong defensive work and ability to hold leads were noted by both players and managers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers' base-running, with nine stolen bases without being caught, was a standout aspect.The Brewers' ability to advance on the basepaths through wild pitches and passed balls was mentioned.The Brewers' young players like Brice Turang and Jackson Chourio are making an impact, especially in defense.
